009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.circle.AlgebraicCircle;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.circle.GeometricCircle;
020
021/**
022 * Common interface for all algebraic circle fits.
023 * @author WB
024 *
025 */
026public interface CircleFitAlgebraic {
027        
028        public enum FitType {
029                KasaA,
030                KasaB,
031                KasaC,
032                Pratt,
033                Taubin,
034                HyperSimple,
035                HyperStable
036        }
037        
038        public static CircleFitAlgebraic getFit(FitType type, Pnt2d[] points) {
039                switch (type) {
040                case KasaA:     return new CircleFitKasaA(points);
041                case KasaB:     return new CircleFitKasaB(points);
042                case KasaC:     return new CircleFitKasaC(points);
043                case Pratt:     return new CircleFitPratt(points);
044                case Taubin:    return new CircleFitTaubin(points);
045                case HyperSimple:       return new CircleFitHyperSimple(points);
046                case HyperStable:       return new CircleFitHyperStable(points);
047                }
048                throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown algebraic fit type: " + type);
049        }
050        
051        /**
052         * Returns parameters (A, B, C, D) of the {@link AlgebraicCircle}
053         * or {@code null} if the fit was unsuccessful.
054         * Parameters are not normalized.
055         * 
056         * @return the algebraic circle parameters or {@code null}
057         */
058        public double[] getParameters();
059        
060        
061        /**
062         * Returns a {@link AlgebraicCircle} instance for this fit 
063         * or {@code null} if the fit was unsuccessful.
064         * @return a {@link AlgebraicCircle} instance or null
065         */
066        public default AlgebraicCircle getAlgebraicCircle() {
067                double[] p = getParameters();
068                return (p == null) ? null : new AlgebraicCircle(p);
069        }
070        
071        /**
072         * Returns a {@link GeometricCircle} instance for this fit 
073         * or {@code null} if the fit was unsuccessful.
074         * @return a {@link GeometricCircle} instance or null
075         */
076        public default GeometricCircle getGeometricCircle() {
077                double[] q = this.getParameters();      // assumed to be (A, B, C, D)
078                if (q == null || isZero(q[0])) {        // (abs(2 * A / s) < (1 / Rmax))
079                        return null;                                    // return a straight line?
080                }
081                else {
082                        return new GeometricCircle(getAlgebraicCircle());
083                }
084        }
085        
086        /**
087         * Used to transform the algebraic parameter vector for sample data
088         * shifted to the reference point specified.
089         * If qq is the parameter vector for the data centered at (xr, yr),
090         * the original parameters q are obtained as
091         * <pre>q = M * qq</pre>
092         * 
093         * @param xr reference point (x)
094         * @param yr reference point (y)
095         * @return the transformation matrix
096         */
097        static RealMatrix getDecenteringMatrix(double xr, double yr) {
098                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][]
099                                {{ 1, 0, 0, 0 },
100                                 {-2*xr, 1, 0, 0 },
101                                 {-2*yr, 0, 1, 0 },
102                                 {sqr(xr) + sqr(yr), -xr, -yr, 1}});
103        }
104}
